results.content:
Being able to follow along and write HTML code is extremely helpful in understanding. And liked that I was able to slow down the speech, because the instructor talks fast at the default speed.
The CSS instruction is good, although it appears that some small steps were skipped because my page came out looking different. The best part was that I was able to fix it myself based on what I have learned.

results.content: It was good. Not everything turned out the way it was demonstrated.  She wrote that she is a fast-lightening responder. That is a lie. I posted a question a month ago and it's still unanswered so not impressed at all!! She used a couple of css animation sites, which was pretty cool.

results.content: A great instructor and a great course. down to earth tuition by  a tutor who explains complicated issues succinctly. She must be among the top five tutors on Udemy. John

results.content: This course is quick and direct - just what I needed. The Bon Voyage project gave me a point in the right direction (i.e. helpful recommendations) to really start doing things on my own. Some of the later lectures are a bit out of order, so be aware that you'll have to shuffle these on your own.

Some of the later lectures are a bit out of order, so be aware that you'll have to shuffle these on your own.

results.content: This is a good course, but the instructor sometimes switches between screens too fast. Nonetheless, I found the information easy to follow, and very useful. I would recommend it to anyone who needs a deeper look at using CSS.
results.content_html: This is a good course, but the instructor sometimes switches between screens too fast. Nonetheless, I found the information easy to follow, and very useful. I would recommend it to anyone who needs a deeper look at using CSS.

results.content: Just what I needed. Learn fast and gain quick practice with HTML and CSS. I can honestly say this is one of the best training experience I've ever had with HTML and CSS. I have over the years gone through various web development training courses. However the training was never comprehensive, project oriented or presented in an easy to understand format. I have to say that the HTML and CSS training I have went through at this course so far with Sandy is exceptional. Sandy speaks in a vocabulary that allows one to really grasp the concepts being presented. All the sections build off the previous and are used to build a real-world project not just demonstration on how to do a specific task. If you dislike learning from a book, this is the course to get. Very engaging and informative. Sandy's videos saved me hours of surfing through the net for bits and pieces scattered information. If you want to arrive at incredible heights in your web development career, Sandy's videos are what I would recommend any day anytime to everyone. Please keep on making more courses like this one, Sandy. Thank you for the great course!

Looking forward to learning more from

results.content:
Pros:
1. Even if you know decent amount of html,css , you will learn many new things as you go on to build the final travel-website project.
2. Instructor did a good job at building the website, and making it responsive to look good on small devices too, using plain html and css. So, I as student got to learn the whole process from scratch.
3. Learnt about new sites where you can find images and graphics.
4. Course has a good primer on using readymade libraries for animations and effects if you dont know javascript and jquery.
Cons:
1. Instructor is not responsive AT ALL. So , be prepared to google stuff when you get stuck, just like i did. Is it difficult ? Yes. Is it doable ? Absolutely.
